page.title: 03King's Sutton Manor
page.content: King's Sutton Manor is the biggest house in the village.The people live there in great style. The nanny showed us round. The Manor has a priest hole in which priests hid during the Civil War. It is thought Charles I used the Manor. There are gargoyles on the drainpipes, which are ugly faces to ward off evil spirits. The nanny told us about a young boy who fell out of his window and died. His parents blocked off his window on the inside and the owner of the house has slept in that room and said he felt his bed being lifted up. It may have been the vibrations from the trains! Nowadays the old hound gates on the beautiful staircase, which stopped the dogs going upstairs, are used to stop the baby falling down.
